bibl.title: Entries in Ignacio Rojas' Day Book or Journal, [19--?]

div1.p: Moran's translation of entries made in Rojas' journal concern payment by Kean for the use of land on the San Jose farm by the yellow fever commission

div1.head: Entries in Ignacio Rojas' Day Book or Journal, [19--?]

list.head: ENTRIES MADE IN Dr. IGNACIO ROJAS' “DAY BOOK” OR “JOURNAL”, WRITTEN BY HIMSELF.
list.item:
Nov. 15, 1900: Today, for the third time, the Military Health Officers
of the American Army entered the San José farm by agreement with the lessee,
Don Antonio Sosa and through mediation of Dr. Echevarria. (Page 75)

January 2, 1901: Collected the check sent by the Major Surgeon of
U. S. V. (Major Reed's rank at the time was Major, Surgeon, U. S. A.) Mr.
Read, value $20.00, covering the first month's rent on the land of the
San José farm occupied by the yellow fever experimental commission, one-
half of which was delivered to Don Antonio Sosa, lessee of the farm. (P. 84)

January 19, 1901: Paid by Major J. R. Kean, U. S. V. (think it should
read U. S. A.) $20.00 American Gold, amount of the 2nd month's rent on the
land of the San José farm occupied for yellow fever experimentation for Dec.
10, 1900 to January 9, 1901. (Page 87)

February 25, 1901: Check sent for forty dollars American gold by Major
J. R. Kean, U. S. V., Disbursing Officer, Columbia Barraks, amount of two
months' rent on the land of the San José farm, for yellow fever experiment-
ation, from January 10 to March 9, at the rate of $20.00 American gold, per
month. Half for Sosa. (Add between "farm and “for” IN MARIANAO). (Page 91)

April 22, 1901: Major J. R. Kean, Surgeon, U. S. Army, Disbursing
Officer, today sent the vouchers for signature for payment of the rent on
Camp Lezar, from March 9 to May 10, in the San José farm, Marianao. (P. 99)

June 11, 1901: Collected from Major J. R. Kean, Surgeon, U. S. Army,
Disbursing Officer, the amount of rent on lands of Camp Lezar on the San
José farm, corresponding to the time from May 9 to July 10 of this year.
$40.00 American gold or $44.00 Spanish gold. (Page 100)

September 29, 1901: Today I returned the vouchers, signed, to Major
J. R. Kean, Surgeon, U. S. A., Disbursing Officer, corresponding to the
two months' rental of the land occupied by Camp Lazear (Experimental Sani-
tary Camp), on the San José farm and which became due on August 10 and
September 9. At the rate of $20.00 American gold, per month, the amount
is $40.00 gold. (Page 116).

October 10, 1901: Today I received the last check of $20.00, amount of
the rent for Camp Lazear on the San José Farm, which became due on the
9th, and they left the farm; delivering (leaving) the two wooden houses
which they built to carry out experiments on yellow fever and mosquitoes.
-- $22.00 (Page 117).

item.p:
March 11, 1901: Collected, at last, the rent of the San Jose farm,
for the period from January 1st to May 15, 1899, which was occupied by
the American troops, 2nd Regiment of South Carolina, which they paid at
the rate of $56.66 per month, American gold, and which amounted to $249.30
American gold, equal to $271.73, Spanish gold ----- $271.73

The order for payment was made by Captain H. J. Slocum, 7th Cavalry,
for the efforts made to that end with the Governor General. (Page 94)

div1.p:
NOTE: Major Jefferson R. Kean (now Brigadier General, Retired) held Vol-
unteer rank from June 4, 1898, to February 2, 1901, when he he assumed
the same rank in the Regular Army, according to seniority.

TRANSLATION OF THE ENTRIES MADE BY JOHN J. MORAN -- DIFFERING SLIGHTLY FROM
TRANSLATIONS MADE BY MRS. PHILLIPS.
